item.title: Bollard sustained damage, near problem pothole, 11th November
item.description:
The bollard on Ermin Way has been hit a number of times by drivers. This cannot now be seen at night as reflective markings are destroyed. It is next to the pothole reported on 5199366 and flooded area on 22033921, making it even more dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding causing road damage, 11th November
item.description:
What3Words location Ermin Way opposite BT phone exchange. Water continues to not drain. Previously raised on 22033719 which was closed with the farcical advice that it should clear in one hour after rain stops. This has been ongoing now for 7 days. It has now resulted in a large pothole which has formed and reported on 5199366.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Discarded road traffic equipment, 11th November
item.description:
The first pic is on New Road just after you turn left out of Pottersfield Road. Some left behind cones. The second pic is a *different" location. It is at the junction of New Road / Station Road / Stockwell Lane. It's a left behind diversion sign from the recent ST work on New Road. Can these be cleared up please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obvious pothole on Corpus Street, towards London Road, 10th November
item.description:
The end space of the top parking bay, closest to 22, Corpus Street. It's very inconveniently positioned where a car's tyres would be when parked. Has only appeared in the last few days.

item.title: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface problem, 10th November

Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Blocked off pavement with verge reduced to mud, 10th November
item.description:
Several months ago, possibly July, a barrier was put up presumably because of the instability of the wall of the property (St Ives Court) on the side of the pavement on Albert Road between East Approach Drive and Marston Road. The situation has been getting worse as everyone has to walk, push prams or cycles over the grass verge which is now reduced to soft mud. There appears to be no action underway to remedy the wall, to allow the tarmac pavement to return to use. Either this needs to be undertaken soon (presumably it is quite a dangerous state) or some kind of paving needs to be laid where the grass verge has turned to mud.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unemptied bin, 10th November
item.description:
This bin by the road entrance to Waitrose has not been emptied for well over a week. Please can someone sort this out. Thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Great Western Road, St Paul’s, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The stream normally runs underground in the road past West Ridge. The pipe is blocked and water now runs widely across the road past Woodbine and Hillside properties., 10th November
item.description:
In freezing conditions ice would form across the full width of the lane and be a serious hazard. A mass of small stones cause the blockage which is visible through the grating outside West Ridge. The problem arose about ten days ago after heavy rain. Please arrange removal of the blockage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bushcombe Lane, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
